text: <http://www.oregonlive.com/portland/index.ssf/2015/07/wounded_cyclist_sues_well-inte.html>

attachments.title: Injured cyclist sues well-intentioned driver who waved, allowing truck's driver to turn and hit her
attachments.text: Cynthia Lewellen, an avid cyclist, suffered cardiac arrest and multiple broken bones after a driver crashed into her in a Northwest Portland bicycle lane in November 2014. Lewellen is suing that driver -- as well as another driver that waved the first driver through.
attachments.fallback: OregonLive.com: Injured cyclist sues well-intentioned driver who waved, allowing truck's driver to turn and hit her

text: oh yeah! people always think I'm crazy when I tell them not to wave cyclists (or any other driver) forward
i HATE the wave
yeah, that is terrible
right-of-way is not a thing you can give up freely.
we’re all following the same rules!
I took my right of way last night and the asshole in a red mustang revved his engine at me like he was gonna hit me if I didn't speed up, then peeled out once I was clear. Sometimes it's a lose-lose
I took a right of way at the intersection of se madison and 7th (stop light with a bike box) and the guy behind me revved and sped by me in the oncoming lane, then changes lanes to the right

oh and yesterday I stopped at a stop sign, a cyclist on the cross-street thought I was being nice, ran her stop sign, turned without a signal and almost crashed into me (I had started to go before I noticed she wasn't stopping)
cyclists are just as bad as car drivers.

<@U0260V1BX>: this. I appreciate some drivers are trying to be helpful by waving me through or being extra-accomodating. End result is that it's forcing me to act in an unpredictable fashion, which is the most dangerous position to be in.
I’d rather just act like a car and wait my turn like everyone else is.

yes. I usually end up just waving them on and then i look like the asshole. Some guy tried to wave me by on a 2-lane one way street and people behind him just started passing him and he just f*cking sat there.
yep
eek
I usually shake my head/say "no" and point to my stop sign
oooh…I like that
even when cyclists next to me take the offer
On a very rare occasion the car driver inquires as to why, and I explain I have a stop sign and s/he doesn't.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8aIfarMPmPQ>

text: less prevalent downtown, but the blinking yellow left is EVIL
haha <@U0260V1BX>
that’s the 4-way stop in my neighborhood EVERY. FUCKING. MORNING.
wonder if DOT could put magnetic sensors in the bike lane, and turn the blinky yellows to reds if the lane is full...
let's end today on a good note: <http://bikeportland.org/2015/07/24/megan-holcomb-recovered-stolen-bike-151189>

attachments.title: Megan Holcomb has recovered her stolen bike! - BikePortland.org
attachments.text: Reunited and it feels so good. Great news Portland: Megan Holcomb, the woman who was visiting our fair city and got her beloved touring bike stolen a few nights ago, has found her bike and the two have been united. Here’s what she just posted on her Facebook page: UPDATE. MAJOR UPDATE: The good in Read More »
attachments.fallback: BikePortland.org: Megan Holcomb has recovered her stolen bike! - BikePortland.org

text: wow we did it guys
46k shares on facebook
so awesome
:smile:
:bike: :heart:
